description: {"blocks":[{"key":"25jug","text":"This protocol is adapted from Russo et al. 2023 methods for high-molecular weight DNA extraction. I modified the protocol to use reagents and incubation conditions used by the Ferris Lab at Tulane University to extract DNA from Mimulus spp. (monkeyflower) tissue (leaf and buds), see protocol. The original CTAB:Chloroform protocol used by the Ferris lab traces back to the Willis Lab at Duke University. The objective of these DNA extractions are to collect fungal DNA present in leaf tissue. I have incorporated sample preparation procedures used by the Arnold Lab at The University of Arizona to eliminate contamination of samples and optimize DNA extractions from preserved leaf tissue for future fungal ITS Illumina MiSeq sequencing. Solid phase reversible immobilization beads (SPRI) utilized are adapted from Rohland and Reich 2012 and Liu et al 2023. All extractions were performed in a sterile biosafety cabinet to prevent sample contamination.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":228,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":30,"length":17},{"key":1,"offset":501,"length":65},{"key":2,"offset":816,"length":22},{"key":3,"offset":843,"length":14}],"data":{}},{"key":"1iami","text":"\nPrior to being placed in CTAB, photosynthetic tissue from plants was surface sterilized with sequential washes in 95% EtOH (10 s) , 0.5% sodium hypochlorite (1 min), and 70% EtOH (1min) and air dried under sterile conditions. Due to the small size of monkeyflower plants, the maximum amount of leaf tissue produced per host were placed in 750- 1000 µL of CTAB buffer and kept at RT until DNA extraction process.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bcomg","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6pjsh","text":"*Several aspects of this protocol, mainly those with reagent amounts and molarities, have changed compared to the Russo et al 2023 protocol and the Willis Lab standard CTAB extraction protocol from ca. 2010.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eep4n","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"amfqo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"024EA393177811EEA9550A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.frontiersin.org/articles/10.3389/fpls.2022.883897/full"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"024EA3D5177811EEA9550A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/96-well-dna-extraction-protocol-for-plant-and-lich-fscbnaw"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"72C67E20185211EE89CD35C6FD1390E7","url":"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/22267522/"}},"3":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6622DDD0185211EE89CD35C6FD1390E7","url":"https://doi.org/10.1186/s12864-023-09211-w"}}}}

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"3c85a","text":"General Notes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fvkq1","text":"DNA Extractions for Illumina Seq. are the most sensitive. If you need high quality low contamination DNA that is high molecular weight, make sure to use the gentler methods of mixing. Use wide bore pipet tips to help reduce shearing of DNA. Do not vortex any samples to mix, just invert or gently tap/flick tubes. To reduce contamination, be sure to check that all samples come out of the first chloroform step with a clear aqueous layer, not cloudy. Sodium chloride (5M NaCl) helps reduce polysaccharide contamination (compared to the Isopropanol precipitation without the added NaCl). High salt concentrations also aid in DNA precipitation, so you should get more DNA precipited and cleaned with chloroform wash. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3uasp","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f7873","text":"Sample Handling ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bk5bg","text":"Gloves must be worn at all times. Change gloves frequently and decontaminate often with DNA Away.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-justify","offset":0,"length":97}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cph94","text":"Pipetting must be done extremely carefully to minimize the risk of aerosols that can easily cause contamination between samples.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c5abl","text":"Use only unopened, sterile, aerosol-resistant pipette tips (filter tips) to minimize contamination of the pipette shaft and your samples. Clean the body of the pipettes regularly with DNA Away.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7g4iu","text":"Discard pipette tips after each use to avoid cross-contamination. Eject pipette tips carefully to prevent aerosol formation or other splashing.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4i9hf","text":"Remember to always clean the hood and any equipment with DNA Away and decontaminate where possible with UV for 30 minutes prior to use to avoid cross-contamination.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9s22t","text":"The pipettes used need to be calibrated annually.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2765t","text":"Be careful not to touch the inside lid of tubes as it will cross-contaminate samples.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d0ai1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
